column5: someone would come up with glass balls that wouldn't show up on a metal detector. but what they need is an X-RAY machine like used at the airport. but even then all money fish should be gutted and inspected for any foreign objects like other fish fillets.

I remember some of the bass tournaments where fish were wither placed in cages or just released in an area and then fished for figuring they wouldn't move too far, our local shad contest experienced the "lead additive" several years ago, now there's this! These guys got caught, I would guess there are a few that didn't!!!! Where there's a will, there's a way, often wondered if anyone was injecting water into the fish to add some weight,
Tournaments need to stop basing off of weight, and instead base off of length. Glad these guys got caught. They will be lucky not to end up with jail time.

Code:Tournaments need to stop basing off of weight, and instead base off of length.I will agree with that ----- Just look at the difference in the weight of a big female right before she spawns.................
Please google 'walleye fisherman cheating'. Holy ****, what are these two men doing? National news.
It reminds me of all the posters of 1,800 fish a week reports, but these 2 idiots should have their boat and gear confiscated by the DNR and banner from getting a license.
I'll have to keep an eye open for the guys I fish with in Ont,hate to lose a dollar getting cheated on with walleyes stuffed with lindy sinkers!start bringing a metal detector along.
Tip of the iceburg. Just saying
There has been cheating going on for years. All those that cheat sooner or later get caught. All those tournaments should be discontinued. That's just my opinion.
there is a 12 page thread on this under general discussion
100% agree on killing the circuits or eliminate the purses
And run the fish through metal detectors like they do people at airports,glad I just fish for fun and the beauty of Ont.
